extracted_information: The Spotify Web API provides extensive artist-related data, allowing developers to retrieve details about individual artists, multiple artists, their associated albums, top tracks, and related artists. Authentication for the API is based on OAuth 2.0, utilizing various authorization flows.

items.name: Get Artist
items.description: Retrieve Spotify catalog information for a single artist identified by their unique Spotify ID.

items.name: Get Several Artists
items.description: Retrieve Spotify catalog information for multiple artists.

items.name: Get Artist's Albums
items.description: Get Spotify catalog information about an artist's albums.

items.name: Get Artist's Top Tracks
items.description: Get an artist's top tracks in a given country.

items.name: Get Artist's Related Artists
items.description: Get artists that are similar to a given artist.

items.name: external_urls
items.description: Known external URLs for this artist, including the Spotify URL.

items.name: followers
items.description: Information about the followers of the artist, specifically the total number of followers. The 'href' field for followers is always null.

items.name: genres
items.description: A list of the genres the artist is associated with. The array is empty if not yet classified. Example: ['Prog rock', 'Grunge'].

items.name: href
items.description: A link to the Web API endpoint providing full details of the artist.

items.name: id
items.description: The Spotify ID for the artist.

items.name: images
items.description: Images of the artist in various sizes, widest first, including URL, height, and width.

items.name: popularity
items.description: The popularity of the artist, a value between 0 and 100, with 100 being the most popular. Calculated from the popularity of all the artist's tracks.

items.name: uri
items.description: The Spotify URI for the artist.

items.name: Core Concepts
items.description: Access Token, API calls, Apps, Authorization, Redirect URIs, Scopes, Spotify URIs and IDs.

items.name: Authorization Flows
items.description: Authorization code flow, Authorization code PKCE flow, Client credentials flow, Implicit grant (deprecated), Refreshing tokens.

items.name: Request Authorization Header
items.description: API requests require an 'Authorization: Bearer <Access Token>' header.
